description: From Middle English playnly, pleinly, pleyneliche, equivalent to plain +â€Ž -ly.

adverbs.description: plainly (comparative plainlier or more plainly, superlative plainliest or most plainly)

entries.meaning: In a plain manner; simply; basically.
examples: She decorated the room plainly but neatly.
You will see that ours is plainly the better method.
